connectfour

Class ConnectFour

  • java.lang.Object
    • connectfour.ConnectFour

  • public class ConnectFour
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows the playing of a virtual game of "Connect Four"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectFour()
      Constructor to create a new instance of a game.
      This default constructor will randomly select the first player.
      ConnectFour(int firstTurn)
      Constructor to create a new instance of a game.
      This constructor allows you to select the first player.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayBoard()
      Display the board by printing it out to the console.
      int getTurn()
      Get which players turn it is.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Checks to see if the game has ended.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method for this class is simply a test where the computer randomly plays out until the game ends by win or draw.
      boolean playMove(int player, int play)
      This method plays a move in the game.
      void startNewGame()
      Start a new game with a randomly selected first player.
      void startNewGame(int firstTurn)
      Start a new game with a user selected first player.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour()
        Constructor to create a new instance of a game.
        This default constructor will randomly select the first player.

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour(int firstTurn)
        Constructor to create a new instance of a game.
        This constructor allows you to select the first player.
        Parameters:
        firstTurn - 0 or 1 - which player goes first.

    • Method Detail

      • startNewGame

        public final void startNewGame()
        Start a new game with a randomly selected first player.

      • startNewGame

        public final void startNewGame(int firstTurn)
        Start a new game with a user selected first player.
        Parameters:
        firstTurn - 0 or 1 - which player goes first

      • displayBoard

        public void displayBoard()
        Display the board by printing it out to the console.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Get which players turn it is. Returns 0 for Player 1, 1 for Player 2 or -1 for no player (eg - game has ended).
        Returns:
        An int representing the player whose turn it is
        0 - player 1
        1 - player 2
        -1 - neither player

      • playMove

        public boolean playMove(int player,
                        int play)
        This method plays a move in the game.
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the move
        play - the column to place the player token
        Returns:
        true if the move was played, false if the move was rejected

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks to see if the game has ended.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method for this class is simply a test where the computer randomly plays out until the game ends by win or draw.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments don't do anything
